articles.description: Oleksandr Usyk further cements his place as a boxing great by stopping Daniel Dubois in round five to become a two-time undisputed heavyweight champion.
articles.title: Usyk v Dubois 2: Oleksandr Usyk blows away Daniel Dubois to reclaim undisputed crown

articles.description: Follow build-up as France face Germany in the last quarter-final at Euro 2025.
articles.title: France vs Germany LIVE: Women's Euro 2025 line-ups, kick-off time & updates

articles.description: Scottie Scheffler continues his imperious march towards a first Open Championship title in a third round which contained all the ingredients to set up a classic.
articles.title: The Open 2025: Scottie Scheffler four clear heading into final round at Royal Portrush

articles.description: With Marcus Rashford set to leave Old Trafford, BBC Sport explains how he ended up on the brink of a remarkable move to Barcelona.
articles.title: Marcus Rashford: Why do Barcelona want to sign the Manchester United forward?

articles.description: The British and Irish Lions start their Test series with victory over Australia but the game finishes flat after showing promise.
articles.title: British and Irish Lions: Lions opener starts with promise but ends flat

articles.description: England cruise past the United States in a weather-affected match in Washington which has almost two hours of delays.
articles.title: USA 5-40 England: Lightning in Washington DC affects dominant win

articles.description: Sophie Ecclestone takes 3-27 as England beat India by eight wickets in a rain-affected encounter at Lord's, setting up a one-day international series decider.
articles.title: England vs India: Hosts complete eight-wicket win at Lord's to set up series decider on Tuesday

articles.description: Remco Evenepoel is forced to abandon this year's Tour de France as Thymen Arensman claims his first stage win.
articles.title: Tour de France 2025 results: Remco Evenepoel abandons race as Thymen Arensman wins stage 14

articles.description: Dakota Ditcheva shrugs off an injured hand to outclass Sumiko Inaba and win by unanimous decision at the PFL Champions Series in Cape Town, South Africa.
articles.title: PFL Africa: Dakota Ditcheva shrugs off injured hand to beat Sumiko Inaba by decision

articles.description: New Zealand captain Ardie Savea says his side had to recover from a tough first to beat France 29-19 and complete a series clean sweep.
articles.title: New Zealand 29-19 France: All Blacks 'punched in the nose' during win
